headline: Surging Data Center Growth to Help Lower Energy Costs for PG&E Customers
summary: Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) is seeing a huge jump in the amount of electricity needed for new data centers. These centers, which power things like cloud storage and artificial intelligence (AI), are expected to need about 8.7 gigawatts (GW) of electricity over the next 10 years. That's a big increase from the 5.5 GW PG&E reported at the end of 2024.

content.title: Surging Data Center Growth to Help Lower Energy Costs for PG&E Customers
content.summary: Pacific Gas and Electric Company (PG&E) is seeing a huge jump in the amount of electricity needed for new data centers. These centers, which power things like cloud storage and artificial intelligence (AI), are expected to need about 8.7 gigawatts (GW) of electricity over the next 10 years. That's a big increase from the 5.5 GW PG&E reported at the end of 2024.

thumbnail.caption: PG&E is seeing a huge jump in the amount of electricity needed for new data centers in Silicon Valley and throughout its service area. PG&E is supporting real estate developer Westbank to build three data centers with up to 4,000 residential units to create a sustainable downtown San Jose. PG&E is host utility of the DTECH Data Centers & AI conference May 27-29, 2025 in San Jose.
